alert.note: Alert for Kauai Southwest; Molokai West; Waianae Coast (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 12 at 3:22PM HST until January 13 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR THE NORTH FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI MAUI AND THE BIG ISLAND THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND MOLOKAI THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY MORNING FOR ALL HAWAIIAN ISLANDS... .A northwest (320 degree) and north (350 degree) swell will pass through the region through Saturday, with both swells peaking at high end advisory levels for exposed north and west facing shores. As the north component becomes more dominate Saturday, surf along west facing shores will fall below advisory levels, while surf along north facing shores lingers above advisory levels. Additional wave run-up is possible during the early morning high tides Saturday and Sunday due to higher than predicted tides. This will likely produce minor to localized moderate coastal flooding Saturday morning. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR WEST FACING SHORES REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST SATURDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH 6 AM HST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, surf peaking at 10 to 15 feet along west facing shores. For the Coastal Flood Statement, minor to localized moderate low lying coastal flooding during times of high tide. * WHERE...For the High Surf Advisory, west facing shores of Kauai, Oahu and Molokai. For the Coastal Flood Statement, any low lying flood prone coastal location. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of beaches that are normally dry, minor coastal erosion, and saltwater inundation. Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous. Submit your coastal flooding photos to the University of Hawaii Sea Grant College Program`s Hawaii and Pacific Islands King Tides Project at: PacificIslandsKingTides.org
info.instruction: Avoid driving through flooded roadways. If you are forced to drive through salt water, be sure to rinse your vehicle with fresh water. Move electronics, vehicles or other valuables to higher ground. Monitor vessels to ensure mooring lines don`t get too tight and watch out for overwash around boat ramps. Secure canoes or other watercraft stowed on beaches. Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.

area.areaDesc: Kauai Southwest; Molokai West; Waianae Coast
